If you're looking for something more contemporary, "The Recruit" is a thrilling spy drama starring Colin Farrell and Al Pacino that might catch your interest as well! Enjoy the movies!

If you're interested in a classic sci-fi thriller, "The Andromeda Strain" might be up your alley. It delves into the mystery of a deadly extraterrestrial contagion and the race to find an antidote. Stars such as David Wayne and Paula Kelly add depth to this suspenseful narrative. Enjoy the journey!

2. Madame Bovary (1856): Starring Emma Watson, this period drama tells the story of a restless woman striving for passion and excitement in her marriage, leading to complicated consequences.

This film follows the Griswold family's chaotic attempts to have a perfect holiday season, which predictably turns into a big disaster. It's light-hearted and festive, making it a great choice for the holiday season!

If you're looking for something more experimental, "Her" might also pique your interest. This film explores modern dating experiences and discusses differences of dating for young single and committed women today, with visual interpretations by male creatives. It's a thought-provoking watch that delves into the complexities of human relationships.
